page.title: 17Landscape and Buildings
page.content: Weston Patrick:Church of St.Lawrence C12 and 1868 by T.H.Wyatt. On an old site and retaining the general form it was rebuilt by the Wyatt family. The porch with timber frame on stone base with arch braced gable encloses the Norman doorway of the original. Much of the fund raising activity of the local community goes towards upkeep of the church. Manor Farmhouse C16,17+18 large timber framed house incorporat- ing 4-bay late medieval cruck framed hall.Granary C17 on 9 stone straddles. Also Wyatt House, Schoolyard Cottage, Yew Tree Cottage and Well Cottage all C17. The planning authority require all these privately owned houses to be well maintained in their present form at the owners expense to preserve the heritage. Also in Weston Corbett Manor Farmhouse C17 and late C19 ,barn and granary with 9 stone straddles
